alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 7:57PM EDT until August 28 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory Now In Effect for Western Mercer County in West Virginia and Northwestern Bland County in Virginia Until 11 PM EDT This Evening... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected or is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Bland and Tazewell. Portions of southeast West Virginia, including the following county, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in Bluefield, Bramwell, Coaldale and vicinity. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have already fallen in and around Bluefield VA/WV and additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is possible during the next few hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bluestone River, Crane Creek, East Fork Cove Creek, Laurel Fork, Flipping Creek, Laurel Creek, Wolf Creek, South Fork Brush Creek, Middle Fork Brush Creek and East River. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in minor flooding, especially in low-lying, poor drainage, and normally flood prone areas. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Bluefield... Rocky Gap... Pocahontas... Bramwell... Sandlick... Clear Fork... Coalwood... - For additional information on stream, creek, river, and lake levels, please visit our web site located at http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary/Preparedness Actions: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
